description: I took the Java track for Software Engineering at WGU.  It was the most-used programming language for my courses.  I have about 1-2 years of experience programming in Java.

I have used SQL for almost every programming class I've taken at WGU.  I create SQL statements for all my current projects that require data management.  I have about 1 year of programming experience in SQL.

I took a few classes of Python from WGU.  I also spent a summer learning Python through Pluralsight before I started my degree at WGU.  I was ranked as an expert by Pluralsight.  I have roughly 1 year of experience programing in Python.

I spent a summer learning C# through Pluralsight.  I was ranked as an expert by Pluralsight.  I am very familiar with the syntax of C# because of my experience programming in Java.  I have roughly 1 year of experience programming in C#.

I use JavaScript regularly with my current job, current projects involving Vue, and everything I've done with HTML scripting.  I am very comfortable with the TypeScript syntax because of my experience with many typed languages.  I was ranked as an expert in JavaScript by Pluralsight.  I have roughly 4-5 years of JavaScript experience.
I have worked with HTML periodically for over 10 years.  My Vue projects rely heavily upon my HTML skills.  If you condensed my experience, I probably have around 2-3 years of experience with HTML.
I frequently use CSS with my HTML projects, including Vue.  My level of understanding is not as high as my other front-end skills.  I would say I have roughly 1 year of useful experience using CSS.
